title: The Road to Big Big Brother: One Man's Struggle Against the Surveillance Society
description: In this entertaining and highly revealing account of his attempt to dodge Britain's 4.2 million CCTV cameras and other forms of surveillance, Ross Clark lays bare the astonishing amount of personal data which is hoarded by the state and by commercial organizations, and asks whom should we fear the government agencies who are spying on us - or the criminals who seem to prosper in the swirling fog of excessive data-collection.
author: Ross Clark
